    • Method Detail

      • getSales

        public java.lang.Double getSales(java.lang.String format)
        Iterates through all tickets, compares them against a given day, month or year, and sums up the money of all sold tickets.
        Parameters:
        format - String Formatter pattern for the date comparison
        Returns:
        the amount of the money from the sold tickets

      • getEmployeeExpense

        public java.lang.Double getEmployeeExpense(int day)
        Iterate through all stuff members, search the income per hour, sum it and multiply with 7,5 and the amount of the days given
        Parameters:
        day - int days to sum up
        Returns:
        the costs for the employees

      • getMovieRentExpense

        public java.lang.Double getMovieRentExpense(java.lang.String format)
        Basicly it sums all rent expenses Iterater over all Movies, check if is rented Iterate over all tickets, search all sold tickets check if the date is matching the given pattern Search all cinema tickets, check if the movie name equals ticket name sum the money and multiply 30% + rent expense
        Parameters:
        format - String pattern to format and search the date by
        Returns:
        returns the rent expenses

      • setTicketSales

        public java.util.Map<CMovie,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> setTicketSales(java.lang.String format)
        Calculates the daily ticket sales Iterate over all movies, search for tickets that has been sold filter tickets from today, if the ticket is reduced, increase amount of reduced tickets else increase the variable for full tickets after all tickets has been evaluated, calculate the sales for all tickets after all tickets has been calculated get the film title
        Parameters:
        format - String pattern to format and search the date by
        Returns:
        returns the hashmap with updated values

        Returns:

      • getTotalSeatCost

        private java.lang.Double getTotalSeatCost(CEvent event)
        Sums up the total cost of a fully sold-out room
        Parameters:
        event - CEvent event to count the seats for
        Returns:
        total price of all seats

      • getPercentages

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getPercentages(java.lang.String format)
        Method calculating the percentages of the different types of possible transactions. For simplicity this method does not add tickets of entirely canceled purchases but ignores single cancellations within valid carts.
        Parameters:
        format - String Formatter pattern for the date comparison
        Returns:
        list of 4 integer values in order of sales, online-sales, reservations, online-reservations
